newsitem.title: USA: MidAmerican Energy to cut Illinois prices.
newsitem.headline: MidAmerican Energy to cut Illinois prices.

text.p: MidAmerican Energy Holdings Co said Wednesday it will lower its electric prices in Illinois by about $2.4 million or two percent effective June 1.

The price reduction is part of a 1996 agreement with MidAmerican, the Illinois Commerce Commission and the Citizens Utility Board. The company lowerd its Illinois prices by 11.5 percent or $13.1 million in November 1996 as part of the deal.
Following the reduction, the typical Illinois residential customer using 745 kilowatt-hours per month would pay $62.25, a savings of $1.13 a month.
